jsonformat.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*H*************************************************************************************/
2 /*!
3  \File jsonformat.h
4 
5  \Description
6  This module formats simple Json, in a linear fashion, using a character buffer
7  that the client provides.
8 
9  \Notes
10  References:
11  JSON RFC: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4627
12 
13  \Copyright
14  Copyright (c) Electronic Arts 2012.
15 
16  \Version 12/11/2012 (jbrookes) First Version
17 */
18 /*************************************************************************************H*/
19 
20 #ifndef _jsonformat_h
21 #define _jsonformat_h
22 
23 /*!
24 \Moduledef JsonFormat JsonFormat
25 \Modulemember Util
26 */
27 //@{
28 
29 /*** Include files *********************************************************************/
30 
31 #include "DirtySDK/platform.h"
32 
33 /*** Defines ***************************************************************************/
34 
35 #define JSON_ERR_NONE (0) //!< no error
36 #define JSON_ERR_FULL (-1) //!< buffer is full, no space to add attribute or element.
37 #define JSON_ERR_UNINIT (-2) //!< did not call JsonInit() prior to writing.
38 #define JSON_ERR_NOT_OPEN (-3) //!< attempt to set elem or attrib, but, no tag opened.
39 #define JSON_ERR_ATTR_POSITION (-4) //!< attempt to set an attrib, but, child element already added to tag.
40 #define JSON_ERR_INVALID_PARAM (-5) //!< invalid parameter passed to function
41 
42 // Encoding control flags
43 #define JSON_FL_WHITESPACE (1) //!< include formatting whitespace
44 
45 /*** Functions *************************************************************************/
46 
47 #ifdef __cplusplus
48 extern "C" {
49 #endif
50 
51 // init the API -- pass in the character buffer. MUST be called first.
52 DIRTYCODE_API void JsonInit(char *pBuffer, int32_t iBufLen, uint8_t uFlags);
53 
54 // notify the API that the buf size was increased
55 DIRTYCODE_API void JsonBufSizeIncrease(char *pBuffer, int32_t iNewBufLen);
56 
57 // finish JSON output to this buffer; use returned pointer ref
58 DIRTYCODE_API char *JsonFinish(char *pBuffer);
59 
60 // start an object
61 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonObjectStart(char *pBuffer, const char *pName);
62 
63 // end the current object -- must have an outstanding open object
64 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonObjectEnd(char *pBuffer);
65 
66 // start an array
67 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonArrayStart(char *pBuffer, const char *pName);
68 
69 // end the current array -- must have an outstanding open array
70 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonArrayEnd(char *pBuffer);
71 
72 // add a string element
73 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonAddStr(char *pBuffer, const char *pElemName, const char *pValue);
74 
75 // add a number
76 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonAddNum(char *pBuffer, const char *pElemName, const char *pFormatSpec, float fValue);
77 
78 // add an integer element
79 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonAddInt(char *pBuffer, const char *pElemName, int64_t iValue);
80 
81 // add a date (will be encoded as a string; use JsonAddInteger for integer encoding)
82 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t JsonAddDate(char *pBuffer, const char *pElemName, uint32_t uEpochDate);
83 
84 // build a JSON output string from a formatted pattern (like vprintf) $$TODO
85 #ifdef va_start
86 DIRTYCODE_API char *JsonFormatVPrintf(char *pJsonBuff, int32_t iBufLen, const char *pFormat, va_list pFmtArgs);
87 #endif
88 
89 // build a JSON output string from a formatted pattern (like printf) $$TODO
90 DIRTYCODE_API char *JsonFormatPrintf(char *pJsonBuff, int32_t iBufLen, const char *pFormat, ...);
91 
92 #ifdef __cplusplus
93 }
94 #endif
